website_summaries.verdict: This portable little cooler is solid and is great for a variety of uses.
pros: Fits a nice amount of food for a meal and does a good job of keeping it cool for a long time
Works well as a lunch cooler
Lid can double as a little table
Can survive a lot of use and abuse
cons: This cooler is very small – can fit only about four drink cans with ice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about ordering this -but for $9.99 it wasn't going to break me if it didn't suit my needs. (Keeping my waters & snacks cold during the day as I travel from place to place for work ) Very happy with this -yes , its small ,but it's perfect and holds just enough .It's big enough to hold 6 Perrier slims , a regular size soda and still had room for a baggies of fruit , and an ice pack. I've included pics for reference.
customer_reviews.author: yogamomma

customer_reviews.title: Fits Six 8 ounce Medela Bottles Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Needed bottles colder longer for travel. Ice packs don’t usually last over 12 hours, but ice can be replenished, so I took a chance. So glad I did :) Fits six 8 ounce bottles with just enough room for ice between all. Best part is I got this for $8 which is way cheaper then most cooler bags!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: So I love this little cooler. I was looking for a small one that would fit into my cooler rack on my Suzuki Z400. But after going through the reviews and questions I was still unable to get accurate dimensions for the bottom as to tell if it would fit. I took the chance anyway and glad I did. It fits perfectly so I thought that I should write a review and give some dimensions to other people that might be looking for a cooler for the same or similar applications. See my pics for the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: josephw13

customer_reviews.title: Clear Ice!
customer_reviews.text: I use it to make clear ice in my freezer. Just the right size (once I removed the carry handle). The ice I make in it comes out crystal clear, apart from the bottom layer where the bubbles and impurities are concentrated. If you've got the freezer space to spare, give it a try - you can find full videos of the technique on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works for Drinks/Ice and Storing my phone in my car  to stay cool
customer_reviews.text: When I have to leave my phone in my car I needed a way to keep the phone cool. (Batteries in phones loose life when exposed to high heat repeatedly). This works excellent combined with "Fit & Fresh Cool Coolers Slim Lunch Ice Packs - Set of 4". I put the phone in a quart size zip log bag and put in 2 to 4 re-freezable packs depending on how hot it would be. the phone and packs were on opposite ends of the thermos and my phone stayed cool by the time I get back to the car. It's small enough to store behind seats or in trunk.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: great to make clear ice blocks
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is awesome , perfect size for those who like to have their whisky with a nice block of clear ice . Works like a charm ! This cooler seems perfect sixmze for baby bottles but works better for clear ice blocks lol
customer_reviews.author: RicanSports

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for ten years as lunch boxes for my kids who ride a 45 minute bus to and from school each day. Eventually the corners cave in after three or four years of use and abuse. (Remember, you paid approx. ten bucks for this item). These coolers are great value IMO. Main strengths: - easier to wash and dry than fabric lunch containers - less risk of pathogens than fabric lunch containers - better insulation than fabric lunch containers - better life expectancy than fabric lunch containers - kids can sit on it or use it as a table - inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Lunch Pail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my lunch cool on hot days. It's made for holding a 6 pack of canned beverages but it is so much more. I carry my lunch daily to the industrial plant I work at. It has held together well and looks just like the day I bought it. The flip lid is perfect for holding a drink in place while eating. Another use I've had for this is transporting milk to the hospital. My twins were born two months premature and we used this to carry milk to the NICU for the twins. It cleans up easily and holds the temperature well. Would recommend for someone who wants a lunch size insulated cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Steph & Bryan White

customer_reviews.title: Happy, but will not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for me, but the lid and handle are kinda shotty. You can tell it's cheaply made. Which is a shame because it says made in America....
customer_reviews.author: Cody Ott

customer_reviews.title: Good little cooler
customer_reviews.text: This would be good for those who pack small lunches, or to keep a couple cold ones cool for a day on the boat. It is pretty small, so make sure you look at the dimensions before purchasing. I use it as a bait cooler for crawfish (crawdads) and worms, and I can fit: 1 small flat ice block on top of; 1 Chineese (rectangular) take out container....filled with crawfish 2 (12) strofoam packs of worms. The ones you would buy from any bait store or walmart. The above is a tight fit, but it works very well and has kept my bait alive during 90degree plus days where I spent 10+hours on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Small, durable, useful. Does what its meant to do. I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Cute little thing. Great for a sturdy little lunch box or a quick trip somewhere where you dont have to carry too many items. I attached pictures to size reference this. The soda cans are the minis (those are the obly size I drink) so make sure you take note of that when doing a dize comparison. Lol. Seems durable, well built, lightweight, and like it would work just like a regular cooler at keeping things cold. Not sure about warmth though. Overall, happy with this. I plan to leave it in the car for those days I want to keep my drinks or whatever cold, or when I take an unexpected trip to the beach!
customer_reviews.author: xtal718

customer_reviews.title: Not very thermally efficient. Wouldn't use this for extended cooling.
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure. My benchmark for keeping things cool are plane old Styrofoam coolers that one might use for a single season and throw away. My litmus test is how long the ice will stay frozen before completely turning to water. In my cheap Styrofoam cooler, that test is over 24 hours, in this product, it's more like 5-6 hours before the ice melts entirely to water. But Styrofoam is non-durable and I needed something I can bang around. Overall I would say it's OK in the durability department but pretty lacking in the insulation department. Probably wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Phineas J Whoopee

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooler
customer_reviews.text: Some people may complain that this thing is too small, but it's the perfect size if you're looking for a small personal cooler. I actually have this strapped onto my electric scooter (emove cruiser) as a seat for my 5yo son to sit on as a seat. The cooler itself is big enough for a 6 pack and some ice. it's perfect for some daily outings to provide some refreshments and snacks. I got this through warehouse deals and it was pretty much perfect. I couldn't tell there were any blemishes on it at all. I highly recommend this cooler!
customer_reviews.author: R. Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Solo Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the fact that It was advertised a great deal. Coleman products really last a long time! This personal cooler suits its description it really is meant for one person. I really like the fact when you shut its lid tbe seal is made so well it’ll keep your soda, food From heat or moisture. Also, its so cute and little! Easy to carry around. Only complaint was the color and the way it looks its so plain hope they make it more colorful and bright in the near future id definitely buy again!! Other than that its worth buying! Thanks Seller and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie D.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works.
customer_reviews.text: What is not to like. I got this for $11 new when others the same size go from $15 to almost $22. It's a plastic cooler, what can be wrong with it. Make sure to look at the inside size to make sure its good for your use and you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact size by a reputable manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Coleman is one of the go-to companies for quality and purpose-built products. This cooler is no exception. This personal model fills the need for a small and easy to transport item. It doesn't hold more than a six-pack of cans with a handful of ice so the 5 Qt. measurement might be misleading. The lid is captive and flips over as a tray, fits tightly but is not water/leak-proof. The cooler keeps things cold for most of the day. Can't complain about performance at this cost. If you need a cooler that holds more, stays cold longer and money is no object, check out a Yeti.
customer_reviews.author: CCV

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooler - not ridiculously overbuilt
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little cooler that bucks the current trend towards massively over-insulated coolers. I'm not a complete indoorsman, but at the same time, I don't need something that'll keep ice from melting over a three day fishing trip. This cooler fits my needs perfectly, whether they be keeping a couple of beers cold when "porch drinkin'" with my neighbors, or a couple of sodas to keep handy on a road trip. This is a cooler that is well tailored to real-world food and drink storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Shapley

customer_reviews.title: I love this cooler!
customer_reviews.text: So I use this cooler for a less conventional purpose - I use this to make clear ice (via directional freezing) at home. It's the perfect size to fit inside my freezer and lets me make crystal clear ice. For other uses - it's pretty sturdy and not terribly heavy. I personally wouldn't use this as a lunch cooler cause of its weight and that I prefer a soft body cooler but if you want a hard body - this is your run of the mill cooler. The lid's also removable for easy access (and won't get in the way too).
customer_reviews.author: Louis C.

customer_reviews.title: The classic
customer_reviews.text: I seem to recall having at least a three of these at a time in my house growing up. It can hold a few cans of pop or a few water bottles on their side. Maybe cold treats in the back of the car. Maybe a cold lunch. Its either a meal for one person or snacks for a few. The top is sturdy but it can flip open and it doesn't lock. This can take hits and keep on working. I use it for car trips on the floor of the back seat or to keep water bottles cool when outside biking or tennis.
customer_reviews.author: theRangel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Small Uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fill with ice water and Sea Breeze to cool down during hot, humid tennis matches, and it's perfect! I wanted something small enough to tote around easily yet big enough to actually use. It looks like it could hold about six cans, though I've never used it for that purpose. I would NOT recommend this for someone wanting to use it as an actual cooler, but I would definitely recommend it for someone needing to just carry a few things or use it to carry cold water.
customer_reviews.author: Emily P

customer_reviews.title: Container not Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Not insulated. If it is, then it isn't insulated well enough to keep drinks cool long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Coley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect personal cooler
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this to leave on the porch for my husband to have easy access to cold beverages while he's outside doing yard work, so he doesn't have to come inside while he's dirty. Now we use it any time we want to have access to cold beverages while we're outside or away from home. One flexible ice pack and four 500ml water bottles laying down is how I pack it. Even on hot summer days, we've left it in the car while we shopped and came back to refreshingly cold beverages.
customer_reviews.author: SheShopsIPay

customer_reviews.title: Adorable 6 Can Personal Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tiny cooler for personal day-outings. Great for chillin' on the back deck, boat, or at the neighborhood pool. Great for happy hour at home, or a sturdy lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep ice from melting
customer_reviews.text: My main refrigerator died several weeks ago so I am using a mini fridge in my kitchen until the new one comes. I have been making ice in my basement freezer. I ordered this cooler so I could keep some ice in the upstairs kitchen. Had read reviews that it did keep ice frozen but this DOES NOT! Within an hour of emptying a full ice tray into the cooler it has completely thawed. I will give it that it seems well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Small. Easy to stow and go
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, this is smaller than I expected, which is not a bad thing. It's very much a one-person cooler and can replace a personal soft cooler. I prefer hard coolers because they are easier to clean and less likely to retain smells. A happy coincidence is that it is smaller enough to stow inside of my Coleman 18-qt Party Stacker. I'm glad this is made in USA and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Clockmilk

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooler
customer_reviews.text: I got this cooler to put the chocolates I that I give to my Doctors as a thank you for their fine service. Keeps them from melting in the car on hot sunny days. They appreciate the chocolates and when I need a little extra attention, a simple reminder of the "candy man" works wonders. Being nice has its own rewards. Also, keeps lunches the proper temp when I was working.
customer_reviews.author: OldnGray

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect to keep my daughters insulin cool that we put in a small salad dressing sized tupperware container, along with a few cold snacks on our 20 hour drive up north from Florida. Love the size. We had so much stuff and it fit perfectly on the floorboard in front of her booster seat with plenty of room to spare. We propped it up a couple times and she got to rest her feet on it so we could keep the blood flowing too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works for 6 pack rack. Very compact with a tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the 6 pack cooler rack on my ATV. Small profile but seems durable. When using the 6 can ice pack you can fit 6 cans but it is very, very tight fit. 6 cans and the ice pack is the max this cooler can handle. Perfect if you want something small/low profile. If you want to carry extra stuff (food or supplies), I would go with some lager or use two.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Flowers USA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Small Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler to take with me to my pool because all I had was an ice bucket that did not keep my drinks cold for very long in the Arizona summer heat. I was very impressed by this little guy because it can hold a six-pack of cans or 3-4 water bottles with ice. It's also lightweight so you can take it with you in your car. I used this cooler every weekend in the Arizona summer heat and it keep my drinks cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, much smaller than I thought, not great quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is ok for a lunch box but was much smaller than I thought it was going to be, which was my fault. I don't have a lot of use for a cooler this size on a ranch-farm but I will keep it in case some on needs a smaller cooler for a pickup for just a few cold drinks. I really was not impressed with this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: RMO

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ice at Work
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep my ice in my office at work. We can no longer use ice machines at work due to COVID, and I have to have my ice in my drinks. This is the perfect size to keep my ice during the day at work. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! On-the-go cold food and drinks!
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. It might not be the biggest cooler but the "small size" is the reason why I purchased it. Not the best size for "get togethers" but its PERFECT for using it as a lunch box to keep food and drinks cold!!!! This small cooler will be used far more many times than I will ever use a bigger one. Plus, the money saved from its use pretty much pays for itself. It will be used for its intended purpose and I got exactly what I was expecting. 5 stars*****
customer_reviews.author: Danny Corona

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to save myself some money when I comes to lunches at work. Price was excellent and it kept my lunch nice and cool even though it was sitting in my hot Jeep. Held 2 cans of pop, a sandwich and 2 puddings as well as 2 ice blocks. The lid flip feature is kinda cool too. It gives you can holders and a small flat area. For $10 it can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Mtnmad!

customer_reviews.title: Adorable but not practical
customer_reviews.text: Adorable but not practical for carrying lunch. Can fill with ice. Can fit water bottles. Can fit soda cans. But since it's hard plastic, the internal capacity is limited. If it doesn't fit exactly, it won't go in. Unlike with soft lunch bags, can't stretch the walls or the top of the cooler. So something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Reader123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small cooler for making clear ice!
customer_reviews.text: Use this cooler to make clear ice for cocktails. The removable lid is the critical part allowing top down freezing. Fill with water almost to the top. Place in the freezer with the lid removed for 24 hours. Remove from freezer and turn upside-down in the sink. Shave off the bottom of the block and let the water drain. You will be left with a 2" thick slab of ice. The slab can be chopped into any size cubes you want. The clear ice is very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Deininger

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at the measurements but I didn't....that said it holds 2 beers (in glass). I replaced a previous cooler as it leaked horribly. I use this cooler mainly for an adult beverage after a hike.
customer_reviews.author: cool'n in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Great personal Small cooler
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for lunch. Holds up to 6 cans. I needed one this small for after my Bariatric surgery and I have to eat 6 times a day so I like to keep my meals cold when I’m on the go and not at home.
customer_reviews.author: kristana11

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We love it but I wish they made a slightly smaller version that would fit in a backpack better with a little latch on it so it could get tossed around. These are so much better than kids lunch boxes that are soft or just not insulated and plastic. Easier to clean, maintain a fresh smell, keeps food cooler etc.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, personal sized food cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great, durable just right size for personal lunch items. It's easy to wash/rinse if it gets dirty. They should make the exterior to allow consumers to decorate, personalize for fun. This makes each one unique especially when you place it at work or in school where there are multiple refrigerators or big refrigerators.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Keeping cool is easy with this
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly excellent insulation performance for something so compact. It's good looking and easy to use and the fact it has a removable lid is a big plus. It's ideal for making crystal clear ice in the freezer which requires the ice to be frozen from one direction only, the top down. Look it up.
customer_reviews.author: falbridge

customer_reviews.title: Great for clear ice
customer_reviews.text: Got this to make clear ice for whiskey and cocktails as per popular YouTube videos, and it works perfectly for that. The flipping lid pops out pretty easily (and fits back in if you want to use it as a regular cooler later), and unlike the supermarket versions there are no random indents on the inside walls so you get a nice big block of ice with flat sides.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Labonte

customer_reviews.title: Ours Just Failed After Only Three Months
customer_reviews.text: We bought ours this summer and it's already toast. Splitting and the bottom collapsed. Just bought the Igloo model same size. Hoping for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdie

customer_reviews.title: Great for clear ice
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this to make blocks of clear ice in my freezer. It's a great size to fit in a small above fridge unit and it produces a good haul of ice in about 3 days. I haven't used it for any purpose but it survives the frequent freezing and refreezing process after quite a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Knapp

customer_reviews.title: I love this little Coleman Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I love this little Coleman Cooler. It is just the right size to take to work, AND it does a pretty good job! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: sedonadustbunny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work lunches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband in case he was unable to use the fridge at work due to sanization concerns with Covid. This is very sturdy. It's small enough to be convenient but large enough to hold agood lunch and snacks for one person. As I've come to expect with coleman products, it is durable. We use small ice packs in it and it retains the cold well.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Needs insulation!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this cooler to make my own clear ice and though it works well for that job, it's pretty bad at its originally intended function - keeping contents cold while outside. Insulation is definitely lacking all around.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal
customer_reviews.text: Not big enough at all for a lunch box. Period. Does not keep items cold through out the day.
customer_reviews.author: charlie warren

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. Needed for husband's lunchbox in construction, his fabric ones crap out after awhile. But it's smaller than I thought it would be. A standard square lunch container (like bread kind) won't fit unless it's tilted which limits the slither things you can fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kayte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lunchbox
customer_reviews.text: Keeps food nice and cold for an 8+ hour work day and beyond with some freezer packs. Great compact size. Doesn't feel or look like a standard portable cooler. Smaller and great for carrying to and from work. Have gotten several questions about where I got it and many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: D11W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel cooler
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small cooler for my tank bag on my motorcycle to keep my insulin and cans of water or pop cold on long tours. This works very well. Fits in my tank bag and keeps cold with a couple of freezer packs all day long. Very nice product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: spot

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good lunch pail or six pack (cans) size
customer_reviews.text: It has insulation foam in between the walls, which is important (not all cheaper coolers have that). The handle and top remove easily to clean more thoroughly if needed. Works well enough to preserve my food, or keep drinks cold for hours. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: LowKey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little size
customer_reviews.text: Tough and durable and do exactly what it's intended. Takes a beating and keeps on cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Sweats at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Even with the dimensions it is still much smaller in person. Still suits my needs. Can’t fit a normal 16 oz bottle of water standing up. It does sweat at the bottom not sure if it’s supposed to and couldn’t get a straight answer from manufacturer. Keeps things cold all day.
customer_reviews.author: Para44

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me!
customer_reviews.text: It is indeed small but I knew that and purchased it because of its size. It is perfect for taking to my child’s sports practice with a few pieces of fruit or to carry the average work lunch. Totally recommended if you need a tiny cooler slightly larger than the average insulated lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Great size for two people! No leaking, flip lid for drink holder, durable, keeps food cold,
customer_reviews.text: Handy cooler for a lunch for two (or maybe one person that eats a big lunch). No problems with leaking like you have with some soft lunch bags. Easy to carry, easy to flip the lid to hold drinks while you eat. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaGirl414

customer_reviews.title: Very small, but great if you need a tiny lunchbox!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as my husband's lunch box, but it was just too small so I had to buy a larger size. This would be great for a kids lunch (it doesn't hold much), or to put snacks or water bottles in for a weekend errands day.
customer_reviews.author: Lalita

customer_reviews.title: Small size helps with portion control.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little cooler!! I've used this every weekday to pack my lunch for 5 months now and it still looks brand new. Very sturdy and I like that the lid flips over giving you a clean place to set your food and a cup holder. This cooler is small but it's the right size for me and it's compactness helps me not pack too much food.
customer_reviews.author: Segruts nairb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to carry foods for lunch or snack. It is the size of a lunch box. Easy to clean, I like the top flip option with cup holder. This was a great purchase to make sure that I have food snacks all the time while raw. Helps a ton.
customer_reviews.author: S. Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: Best little cooler ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best little cooler I brought. For the price you can’t beat the buy. I brought it so my Dad could keep his drinks in it since he is hypoglycemic so he can put ice in it and 6 hours later his drinks are still cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kyt

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy
customer_reviews.text: It was a cute and well made little cooler but way too small for what I needed. I didn't realize just how small it was. I returned. Customer service was great issuing my refund and accepting return. I gave 3 stars only because it was too small.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Cooler for making Clear Ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler solely to make clear ice in my deep freezer and it does a great job. I recently installed a high quality water filtration system and wanted to use that water to make high quality clear ice like in the great watering holes of America and the fact I don't like melted ice water in my higher spirit drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Arrington

customer_reviews.title: Small cooler, awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cooler for the price! We use this as our bait cooler for fishing. It’s the perfect size for several extra small Tupperware containers and ice to keep the bait cool.
customer_reviews.author: Windy Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, weight, and rigidity.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this cooler. Easy to haul around and fits my 2 primary needs: holding ice water for dunking rags to cool off out in the sun or keeping family drinks/snacks cool. The soft coolers tend to sweat or even leak, getting the rest of your "stuff" wet. This one stays dry. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Coleman always makes good products!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for carrying a soda or beer six-pack. Filled up with ice, the melt off rate is slow and will last for many hours. Easy to use and transport. Excellent value for the money. I now plan on ordering one more.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Keller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kayaking trips
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in the back storage hole of my kayak. Perfect for holding a small lunch for two people and a little snack for our kayak lunches. Keeps things cold and I love the flip top lid to use as a table on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good for price!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and nice except one thing that it doesn’t keep it cool long enough than I expected. I use it to keep fishing baits cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. incredible

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for making clear ice - specific use
customer_reviews.text: I know people won't typically use it in this way, but for my purposes of freezing ice for clear ice, it worked exactly the way I wanted it. It seemed pretty rugged as I banged it against the counter. Also small and compact so that it can fit in my freezer easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jagged

customer_reviews.title: i love this cooler
customer_reviews.text: i love this cooler. i dont really need it to keep stuff cold because we have a fridge at work, but it does an adequate job for that on road trips. the reason i got it was because i always felt like my cloth reusable lunch bags were absorbing smells or getting all germy. i love that i can wash this out with soap and water easy peasy. it is small, it holds a six pack and a couple (small) fridge pack thingys and thats it. i have some small square tupperware that fits in there perfectly for my lunches. so it just depends on what your needs are but this is a great little cooler for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for car
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my water cold while in my car during these hot summer days and it works great. I can fit 2 bottles on water and a small container of food. It serves its purpose and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Unique

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch box
customer_reviews.text: It keeps cool stuff cool or warm stuff warm. I ordered one in red and one in blue. It holds three sandwiches and fruit or a large burrito or a small six pack of beverages. I use one for food and one for drinks. It does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Baba Ganush

customer_reviews.title: we bought the same brand product of larger size at ...
customer_reviews.text: we bought the same brand product of larger size at lower price from nearby grocery store. Had return this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Has a hinged lid which I didn't know when I bought it. But, I like the convenience of the lid being a part of the unit. Can hold six cans, but not much room for ice. I find that 4 cans fit, with enough ice to keep them cold a long time. Excellent service from Amazon, as always...delivered on time, or earlier... easy to exchange or return...which I have done maybe twice in ten years! You just do things right all the time, so I have no real "need" for customer service. But, I know can it's there if I need it! Craig
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: 5 QT COOLER
customer_reviews.text: I like Coleman products. I bought this one for the color, because I prefer Blue to Red. It is slightly small for bottles, like water or iced tea, but it will fit 6-12 oz cans very well.
customer_reviews.author: Noel K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just needed something small for shoreline fishing, to keep the bait frozen. The lid also serves as a flat surface/tray while still covering the cooler, which is a nice feature. It's also just right for taking a six pack down to the pool with plenty of space around the cans for the ice cubes. We've tried several other transport methods but they all leaked eventually. This cooler, of course, doesn't present that problem. We looked for something like this at 'the big box stores' but none of them carried this size. Amazon came through once again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than Any Other Cooler I Have Used.
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely on my walker seat so I always have what I want to drink. Keeps drinks very cold for 24 hours. I use two bottles of frozen water on top to keep cans cold. Then I have ice water available later in the day. I fill it up every night and refill again the next night
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: great for a taking a six-pack with you or a ...
customer_reviews.text: great for a taking a six-pack with you or a small lunch without wanting to lug around a large ice chest. Can stand up to being tossed around a little bit, so squishy stuff that needs to stay cold can be put in there.
customer_reviews.author: JackD

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price for the quality
customer_reviews.text: The best little flip over lid acts as a lunch tray while you're eating. Clever! Coleman is brand name goodness - this will be my lunch box for years to come. Holds a 6-pack of cans with a little ice, or lunch with an ice pack slipped along side the food. Can't beat the price - we bought two!.
customer_reviews.author: Gadod

customer_reviews.title: Very good sale price for a small but rigid cooler
customer_reviews.text: We once owned a small rigid cooler but it was stolen. This new red cooler is a fine replacement. The sale price was very attractive and the size was big enough for a few items.
customer_reviews.author: Retired engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size cooler
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these coolers, but wanted another, and have not been able to find them in any of the local stores, but AMAZON had them! It is the perfect size for my back pack, fits inside it perfectly, keeps things nice and cold.
customer_reviews.author: run2it

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Ensure Cold All Night
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler to keep my Ensure cold overnight. It does that very well and my Ensure is cold and ready for me to take my morning pills. BTW: I keep two bottles in this cooler and they'd stay cold for close to 24 hours using this cooler with a medium size blue ice blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday for work for months. Cheap and effective. I fill empty space with ice packs and stuff is still cold 8 hours later! The key to any insulated container or cooler is to fill with items that are already chilled and fill unused space with ice.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you would think but def a great product
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought but that’s what I was looking for. It says it’ll hold 6 cans of soda. More like 4. But I wanted something small to pack a small lunch for my husband on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little cooler to bring to the pool for an adult and child.for a couple hours. It does fit less than the small Igloo Playmate coolers, but it also costs less. It is lightweight, the lid fits tightly but is also easy to open, and the handle makes it easy to cary.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a lunchbox. Holds a cold pack, sandwich, bag of chips, bottle of water, and fruit (typically apple or banana) without any problem. I still have room for a pill bottle for my medicine, and few small things I tote back and forth to work everyday, ie e-cig, e-juice, batteries, etc. The insulation isn't that great the outside feels noticeably cold to the touch, so the cool is escaping. That being said, it is still sufficiently cold when I eat my lunch, typically about 7 hours after I leave the house, so I'm not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for making clear ice in your freezer, pop off the top, stick it in the freezer, don’t let it freeze all the way. Turn it upside down, let it drop! Voila!!! Clear ice for your drinks! Ice pick yourself to cubes!
customer_reviews.author: Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Personal Size Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very fast, just as described and in prefect condition. This cooler is exactly what I needed to have my own personal ice at school, the quality is above the rest, so I know it will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Russell

customer_reviews.title: Using this to make clear ice
customer_reviews.text: Saw it on a video channel. Fill up with water, lid off, put in freezer for 24 hours. Take out and break the unformed ice on the top off after taking it out and have perfect clear ice for drinks, etc...
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, lots of room for lunch and a drink or a six-pack. Keeps food chilled all day. My only, small, gripe is the awkwardness in opening the box. The finger hold is quite shallow for anyone with anything but the shortest of fingernails. Otherwise I’d have rated it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: mitty

customer_reviews.title: Use it to keep bait cold/frozen
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep my bait cold when fishing. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sudesh

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Its tiny.
customer_reviews.text: Its much smaller than I expected. I was looking for something to hold drinks. This holds 6 but very little ice to keep them cold. I would say this would work for small lunches but anyone with a hearty appetite would have to pass for this to be a lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: Brittannie

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Perfect nurse lunch box.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I hate when liquids leak in my lunch and get into the fabric seams of my soft lunch boxes. This is easy to clean, the perfect size, and it was so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza J.

customer_reviews.title: Good but tiny
customer_reviews.text: The unit is tiny!!! I should’ve researched the dimensions first - so that’s on me! It works great otherwise, lightweight, easy to keep clean, keeps things cold with frozen packs...
customer_reviews.author: Birdlady710

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my lunch cold all day.
customer_reviews.text: I usually eat a cold-cut sandwich and fruit for lunch. I pack it around 8am when I leave and everything is still nice and cold when I open it up for lunch at 12:30.
customer_reviews.author: Mister C.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong advertisement.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ice chest because I thought it be good enough to keep ice. It is good for maybe 12hrs but after that your ice will start to melt. How long is this suppose to last?What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Collins

customer_reviews.title: Functional little cooler that keeps lunch and snacks cool for an outing
customer_reviews.text: Love this little cooler which is perfect for a lunch plus snack for an outing. I bought it for a cycling excursion. With several small icepacks this cooler kept my sandwich and grapes cool for a hot day. The top flips over and has built-in grooves for holding drinks. Very cute and functional!
customer_reviews.author: Alice C

customer_reviews.title: Great size and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman FlipLid 6 Personal Cooler was purchased for a friend who is blind. The one he had for many, many years finally wore out. He tried a variety of coolers for his lunch....none were as easy for him to use. He couldn't manage the zippers or the hard plastic tabs. The Flip Lids allow just that....the top fits snuggly but is easy to flip up. It also slides back, if you prefer to use that option. For my friend, these features make all the difference. He carries his lunch and snacks to work every day and can manage this personal cooler without having to ask for assistance. It allows him greater personal independence!
customer_reviews.author: vintageharper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a forest job
customer_reviews.text: My spouse works in the forest and this cooler will be perfect to keep lunches cool during long days. The hard sides will hold up against the heavy wear and tear of the job!
customer_reviews.author: AL Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Cute and it fits 6 but put the cans in first then ice and it cools them pretty fast love it I drink diet pop so I got it so I could just bring my own pop to peoples houses when I go visit
customer_reviews.author: Cowboyyeeyee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my need
customer_reviews.text: This little cooler is perfect for carrying my blood samples to the lab on a hot summer day. i found a ice pack that fits perfectly on the bottom. This would be great for a diabetic to store insulin for travel.
customer_reviews.author: mcjojam

customer_reviews.title: Great but too small
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing a lunch box from the same maker. It was the same basically, but much smaller than I thought. I couldn't use it for much sand gave it away. Mmt fault for not paying attention to the description.
customer_reviews.author: J. Malik

product_meta.title: Coleman FlipLid Personal Cooler, 5 Quarts
product_meta.description: Take a cooler and a mini table with you to your next event when you bring along a Coleman 5 Quart FlipLid Cooler. Large enough to hold 6 cans, you'll have plenty of space to pack a full meal. Whether you're bringing lunch to work or heading out for an afternoon picnic, the bail handle makes getting to your destination easy. Once you arrive, the FlipLid hinged lid flips over for use as a tray with molded beverage holders. When the fun is done, the EZ-Clean top wipes clean, so you're ready for your next fun adventure.
feature_bullets: Small, portable cooler keeps food and beverages cold
Reversible FlipLid with molded beverage holders provides stable surface
Bail handle for convenient one-handed operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
